cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi NNE of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic and 70 mi SE of Grand Turk Island
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest across the Turks & Caicos and Bahamas, then curving northwest toward south Florida and northward into Georgia/South Carolina early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys
weather_observation.warning_coast: Dominican Republic north coast, Haiti north coast, Turks & Caicos, all of the Bahamas (southeastern, central and northwestern)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) increasingly likely Monday; 34 kt cumulative probability 65% and 50 kt cumulative probability 38% with a small (13-18%) chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–6 ft surge along the Charleston harbor and adjacent coast if the center tracks inland just to the west of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Monday–Tuesday with locally higher totals causing flash-flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells and dangerous rip currents ahead of the storm; possible tornadoes in outer rain-bands.
